snippet: As they did successfully in 2012 against Mitt Romney, Democrats are painting the Koch brothers as indifferent to the struggles of ordinary people.
abstract: Democrats are reviving strategy they used against Mitt Romney in 2012 and directing it toward conservative moguls David and Charles Koch, painting them as callous and indifferent to lives of ordinary people in their pursuit of profit and power; are seeking to make villains of the reclusive billionaires, whose political organizations have spent more than $30 million on ads so far to help Republicans win control of Senate.

byline.original: By JEREMY W. PETERS and CARL HULSE

lead_paragraph: As they did successfully in 2012 against Mitt Romney, Democrats are painting the Koch brothers as indifferent to the struggles of ordinary people.

headline.main: To Strike at Kochs, Democrats Revive Tactic That Hurt Romney
headline.print_headline: To Strike at Kochs, Democrats Revive Tactic That Hurt Romney
